unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Plant Survival
question_text:
The probability that a particular species of plant survives the winter is $0.7$. Charlotte has $22$ plants of this species.
What is the probability that at least $17$ of her plants survive the winter?
solution:
The easiest way to solve this is by using the calculator function binomcdf ($22, 0.7, 16$). The result is $0.687$, but this is the probability that $16$ or fewer plants survive.

The question asks the probability that $17$ or more plants survive, so you must subtract your calculator answer from $1$ to get the correct answer of $0.313$.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.

Alternatively, you could determine the solution by hand.

The probability that $17$ plants out of the $22$ survive can be represented by the first $17$ plants survive times the next $5$ plants do not survive times the number of different ways $17$ out of $22$ plants can survive.

$$0.7^{17} \cdot 0.3^{5} \cdot {}_{22} C_{17}$$

Use the same methods to find the probabilities of $18, 19, 20, 21,$ and $22$ plants survive, and find the sum of these probabilities.
